Thewirecutter.content: Right now, if youre not an essential worker, staying at home is the best thing you can do to help slow the spread of the coronavirus in the US. But staying put can be mentally grueling, which is why it might be a good idea to find some things to do to pass th… [+8747 chars]

Makeupandbeautyblog.title: Saturday Surfing, April 4, 2020

New Scientist.author: Adam Vaughan
New Scientist.title: Coronavirus will play out very differently in world's poorest nations
New Scientist.description: Cases of covid-19 have been slow to appear in developing economies, but now they are ramping up. Slums and refugee camps could be particularly vulnerable
New Scientist.content:
By Adam Vaughan
Children wearing facemasks in Nairobi, Kenya
Donwilson Odhiambo/ZUMA Wire/PA Images
The new coronavirus may prove disastrous for the worlds poorest people, including those living in slums and refugee camps.
Cases were slower to appear in d… [+5568 chars]

BBC News.title: My Money: 'People have started leaving their houses again'
BBC News.description: As part of a BBC blog series, Jen Smith talks us through one week as pandemic restrictions ease in Shenzhen.
BBC News.content:
Image copyrightJen SmithImage caption
 Jen Smith lives in Shenzhen, where it's compulsory to wear a mask outside at all times
